titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Charles Frederick Park Papers
titlestmt.author: Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.abstract: Collection largely consists of correspondence with professional colleagues and correspondence which covers Park's activities in national and international geological organizations (especially the Society of Economic Geologists and the International Association of the Genesis of Ore Deposits), mineral explorations, work as a mining consultant, and the School of Earth Sciences at Stanford. Other materials include papers, addresses, lectures, research proposals, newsletters, minutes, financial records, reports, articles, and clippings.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Charles Frederick Park Papers (SC0135). Department of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: Professor of geology (1946-1969; emeritus, 1969-); and Dean of the School of Earth Sciences (1950-1965).

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: Collection largely consists of correspondence with professional colleagues and correspondence which covers Park's activities in national and international geological organizations (especially the Society of Economic Geologists and the International Association of the Genesis of Ore Deposits), mineral explorations, work as a mining consultant, and the School of Earth Sciences at Stanford. Other materials include papers, addresses, lectures, research proposals, newsletters, minutes, financial records, reports, articles, and clippings.

did.unittitle: AAPG (The American Assn. of Petroleum Geologists) - Ind. -Acad. Rel. Com.
AIME (American Institute of Mining, Metallurgical and Petroleum Engineers)

scopecontent.p: Contains Park paper delivered at AIME meeting in Duluth, Minn. 1/12/70 - "Affluence".

did.unittitle: AIME Comm: "Ore Deposits of the Western States"

scopecontent.p: Contains 8x18 glossy photo of group, including Park, 1962.
Contains statement of Park before the Subcommittee on Antitrust and Monopoly, U.S. Senate Hearings, May 28, 1969.

did.unittitle: CAPES (College Association for Public Events and Services)
IFSEG (International Federation of Societies of Economic Geology)
International Oil and Gas Ed. Center

scopecontent.p: Correspondence, articles, reviews re. Encounters With the Archdruid by John McPhee, 1971.
Includes Park article "2000 A.D. - People and Resources" (by Park and M.C. Freeman), Jan 1970, with preliminary research material and correspondence.
Includes correspondence re. Earth Resources forum of lectures broadcast over the Voice of America in 1971, for which Park was planner and co-ordinator.
Includes correspondence as described in Box 16, Folder 11. Also includes copies of the lectures including Park's "Resources for the Future".
Includes TLS acknowledgments of birthday greetings from Earth Sciences Dept.; copy of two addresses delivered by Hoover in Belgium on July 4-5, 1958.
Includes Park paper "Minerals adnd United States Policy".

did.unittitle: IAGOD (INTERNATIONAL ASSOCIATION ON THE GENESIS OF ORE DEPOSITS) - GENERAL MATERIAL

scopecontent.p: Includes Park paper "Zoning in Ore Deposits - the Pulsation Theory and the Role of Structure in Zoning", delivered at a symposium in Prague, Czechoslovakia in Sep 1963.
Includes material on the genesis and organization of IAGOD.
Includes further material on the organization and statutes of IAGOD.
Includes correspondence re. symposium in Scotland sep 1967.
Includes correspondence re. plans for meeting in Czechoslovakia in Aug 1968.

Material re. IMA-IAGOD meetings in Japan Aug - Sep 1970. This folder also includes carbon copy of letter by Dr. Jan Kutina of Czechoslovakia to the United Nations proposing nomination of an International Committee on the creation of a University of the United Nations and the establishment of a temporary "United Nations Institute of Geological Sciences", dated Jan 31, 1970.
Further material on membership is also scattered throughout the folders in Boxes 19-21.

did.unittitle: Committee on Tectonics of Ore Deposits
IAGOD (International Assoc. on the Generation of Ore Deposits)
State Board of Registration for Geologists and Geophysicists
Proofs and Revisions of Texts on Ores by Charles Park
Homestake Mining Company: Seventeen bound reports (1965-1975)
